meanings.definition: headfishes: plural noun, a type of fish that has a large head
meanings.sent1: The headfishes in the aquarium were the biggest fish there.
meanings.sent2: I saw a school of headfishes swimming in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The headfishes gathered around for their morning feeding, looking quite eager.
meanings.sent4: The headfishes in the pond seemed to be the wise elders of the underwater world.
meanings.sent5: The headfishes with their large heads were easy to spot among the other fish.

meanings.definition: headfishes: verb, to lead or guide a group of fish
meanings.sent1: The experienced fisherman would headfishes the group towards calmer waters.
meanings.sent2: The mother fish would headfishes her little ones away from danger.
meanings.sent3: The young fish tried to headfishes their friends in a game of underwater tag.
meanings.sent4: The captain of the ship headfishes the crew through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The wise old turtle was known to headfishes lost fish back to their homes.

meanings.definition: headfishes: adjective, relating to the head of a fish
meanings.sent1: The headfishes anatomy book had detailed illustrations of different fish heads.
meanings.sent2: The headfishes features of the shark made it a fearsome predator.
meanings.sent3: The headfishes decorations on the submarine were quite colorful and eye-catching.
meanings.sent4: The headfishes design of the underwater robot allowed it to maneuver easily.
meanings.sent5: The headfishes characteristics of the anglerfish made it unique among its peers.
